abstract: Saudi Arabia's execution of Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr on terrorism charges seals once-obscure preacher's status as icon and martyr for country's Shiite minority; inflames regional rivalry between Saudi Arabia and Iran and its Shiite allies, who have adopted Sheikh Nimr as symbol of Sunni-dominated kingdom's repression of Shiites.
lead_paragraph: The rise to prominence of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, who was scarcely known outside of Saudi Arabia before his arrest in 2012, corresponds closely with the intensification of the rivalry between Shiite Iran and Sunni Saudi Arabia.

headline.main: Shiite Cleric Gained in Status as a Rivalry Deepened
headline.print_headline: Cleric Gained in Status as a Rivalry Deepened

snippet: The rise to prominence of Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, who was scarcely known outside of Saudi Arabia before his arrest in 2012, corresponds closely with the intensification of the rivalry between Shiite Iran and Sunni Saudi Arabia.
